title: Innospace gets license for first orbital launch attempt
summary:
South Korean launch startup Innospace says it has received government approval for its first orbital launch attempt, which could take place as soon as the end of the month.

title: Sunset on V2: The End of an Era at Starbase
summary: On Monday, October 13th, 2025 at 6:15pm Booster 15-2 and Ship 38 lifted off from Launch Pad 1 at SpaceX’s Starbase, Texas launch facility and closing out the V1/V2 chapter of the Starship program.

title: China resumes launches for Thousand Sails constellation, CAS Space launches new international payload
summary:
China conducted the first launch for the Thousand Sails constellation since March as the country continues its recent rapid rate of orbital launches.

title: Arianespace Pushes First Ariane 64 Flight Back to 2026
summary:
Arianespace has confirmed that the first flight of the more powerful, four-booster variant of the Ariane 6 rocket will not be launched until 2026. The first Ariane 64 rocket had been expected to launch in late 2025, carrying the first batch of Amazon’s Project Kuiper satellites. On 16 October, Arianespace, the commercial operator of the […]
The post Arianespace Pushes First Ariane 64 Flight Back to 2026 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg
summary: The Starlink 11-19 mission will be SpaceX’s 50th launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base in 2025. It’s targeting liftoff from pad Space Launch Complex 4 East at 10:59 a.m. PDT (1:59 p.m. EDT / 1759 UTC).

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Falcon 9 rocket on record-breaking 31st flight
summary: The Starlink 10-17 mission will add another 28 broadband satellites into low Earth orbit. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 11:49 a.m. EDT (1549 UTC).

title: France and Germany Agree to Implement ODIN’S EYE Missile Warning System
summary:
On 15 October, the Defence Ministers of Germany and France signed an agreement to jointly implement the ODIN’S EYE missile early warning system.
